author: abcoathup
content: <@412614104222531604> is there a summary of any decisions or a recording?

author: parithosh
content: I can writeup a summary, recording should be out soon - we're just figuring out who can grab it

author: parithosh
content:
Summary: 

Is there a better place to post it, like an ethMagicians thread or something else?

author: timbeiko
content: When we did these for the last fork, we opted to not record or stream them so that client devs feel comfortable discussing potentially sensitive security issues with WIP implementations. I'd lean towards continuing that, and providing public notes (as Pari has done above) for those who can't make it to quickly catch up. Does that seem reasonable?

author: sky.cactus
content: Couldn't you just cut out any "security critical" parts (and credibly commit to doing so)?  That way devs can still have comfort in discussing things, and people can watch the 99% of recordings that don't have such discussions?

author: timbeiko
content: Happy to defer to client teams on what they prefer here!

author: _shemnon
content:
I prefer to have no video/stream and go one step further: boot people who aren't in the business of implementing the clients or testing them (do we already do this?)  

I want to be able to provide a quick take on issues without it showing up on twitter or coindesk, which goes beyond security IMHO.
